abstract: Ruth Ellen Brosseau, who thrived in Canadian parliament after being elected by fluke in 2011 to seat in Quebec, easily wins re-election while many in her New Democrats party are ousted; political novice had made connection with her constituency, quickly earning respect of colleagues; her efforts on behalf of local homeowners suffering from defective concrete became key to her re-election.
lead_paragraph: Ruth Ellen Brosseau entered Parliament as an obscure slate-filler in 2011, but she seized her good fortune with both hands.

headline.main: Accidental Lawmaker in Canada Defies Critics, and Liberal Party Resurgence
headline.print_headline: Accidental Lawmaker in Canada Defies Critics, and Liberal Party Resurgence

snippet: Ruth Ellen Brosseau entered Parliament as an obscure slate-filler in 2011, but she seized her good fortune with both hands.
